seo.metaTitle: NWA Daily - A daily newsletter about all things Northwest Arkansas
seo.metaDescription: NWA Daily is a daily email newsletter that keeps readers up to date on the latest Northwest Arkansas news or NWA news in events, restaurants, business,  the community, politics, art, entertainment, culture, and sports in Northwest Arkansas including news about Bentonville, Rogers, Springdale, and Fayetteville

posts.title: Begin Your Sustainable Journey in 2023 With Ozark Compost
posts.content:
Ozark Compost & Swap has diverted over 50,000 lbs of waste from local landfills by offering compost pickup and zero-waste product delivery services to Northwest Arkansas. 

  • Convenient composting: With easy-to-follow compost guides, seven-day customer support, and text notifications, composting could not be easier. Fill up your 5-gal bucket with compostable items and OCS will pick it up and swap it for a clean one on a weekly or bi-weekly basis. 
  • Conscious consumption: Include a subscription for ground or whole-bean Airship coffee with your deliveries, and find eco-friendly, zero-waste products on Ozark Compost's online shop.

The first 50 NWA Daily readers to sign up will receive a free month of bi-weekly pickups and a free refillable coffee canister when you add a coffee subscription using the code OCS2023 or by clicking HERE.

posts.title: Tyson Foods Reports Record Sales Despite Challenging First Quarter
posts.content:
Tyson Foods CEO Donnie King reported the company's first-quarter earnings yesterday, citing market challenges and operational inefficiencies as reasons for being behind analyst predictions while maintaining an optimistic outlook for the rest of the year.

  • Bumpy start: Rising costs in beef and chicken created challenges for the company, and despite record-high first-quarter sales of $13.26b, the protein giant earned just 0.88 cents per share, down more than 70% from last year's GAAP EPS of $3.07.
  • Forward view: King maintained a strong vision for Tyson's future and displayed confidence in the company's brand strength and the strong execution of Q1 goals to grow volume, improve staffing levels, and invest in automation while maintaining a focus on liquidity and financial health.

Read more from Talk Business & Politics HERE.

posts.title: Bentonville Initiates Project ARROW To Solve Affordable Housing Crisis
posts.content:
After the Bentonville Housing Affordability Workgroup's year-long study on the affordable housing crisis affecting Northwest Arkansas, the City Council will adopt solutions from their proposed Project ARROW, which stands for Action, Reaction, Result, Outcome, Wins.

  • Reasons to build: The project includes an incentives program for developers based on the level of benefit offered to residents and would expedite the approval process and reduce the development cycle time for builders providing affordable housing options.
  • The archer: The proposal calls for an Affordable Housing Manager, a new city position to work with developers, oversee compliance, identify additional funding, and coordinate with city departments.

Read the full report HERE.

posts.title: Little Shop Of Horrors On Stage At The Victory Theater In Rogers
posts.content:
Arkansas Public Theatre presents Little Shop of Horrors, performing on the mainstage at The Victory Theater in Downtown Rogers on Feb 10-12, 16-19, and 23-26.

  • Not for Disney: Howard Ashman and Alan Menken, the folks behind Disney's The Little Mermaid and Beauty and The Beast, created Little Shop of Horrors, the story of floral shop assistant Seymour Krelborn who develops a strange relationship with a foul-mouthed, R&B-singing, carnivorous plant which promises him fame and fortune for a steep price.
  • Mainstage: Arkansas Public Theatre aims to make the Rogers Historic District a regional destination by providing live theater experiences in the historic Victory Theater, originally built in 1927.

Tickets begin at $25. Reserve yours HERE.

posts.title: New Aquarium Opens At Rogers Pinnacle Hills Promenade
posts.content:
Blue Zoo opens today at the Pinnacle Hills Promenade Mall in Rogers, becoming Northwest Arkansas's first aquarium.

  • New spot: Housed in a 22,000 sq. ft store within the central strip of the mall, the aquarium will be a great new attraction in the region to entertain the kids, host school field trips, throw birthday parties, and host corporate events.
  • With the animals: Blue Zoo provides hands-on learning opportunities, allowing visitors to interact with animals, like petting the stingrays, feeding exotic birds, and walking through a room full of butterflies.

Get your tickets for Blue Zoo HERE.

posts.title: Bentonville Hosts 34th International Conference On Outdoor Leadership
posts.content:
The Record in Bentonville will play host to The Wilderness Education Association's 2023 International Conference on Outdoor Leadership this week from Feb 8-11.

  • Host with the most: This year's theme is "Cultivating Innovation," for which Bentonville is a perfect host, having set itself apart in the outdoor industry by leading the charge in the intersection of natural resources, outdoor recreation, and economic development.
  • The rundown: The conference schedule includes keynote speakers, breakout sessions and workshops, networking opportunities, and outdoor activities like trail runs around Bentonville.

Read more from Talk Business & Politics HERE.

posts.title: Fayetteville Mayor Lioneld Jordan Delivers State Of The City Address
posts.content:
On Feb 2, Mayor Lioneld Jordan delivered the 2023 State of the City address to the Fayetteville community, recognizing the city's accomplishments and casting vision for the future.

  • Looking back: Describing the city's state as "sound," Mayor Jordan called attention to the city's accomplishments in infrastructure, the economy, and the environment, giving credit to the public service workers who have contributed to the city's growth.
  • Looking out: Jordan called for a more substantial investment toward affordable housing options for the city's at-risk residents, balancing the remaining portions of American Rescue Plan funding between amenities that would benefit all residents and those supporting our most vulnerable neighbors.

Read NWA Democrat Gazette's summary of the address HERE.

posts.title: From Broadway With Love Bringing Your Favorite Show Tunes To NWA
posts.content:
Bringing your favorite Broadway show tunes all the way from New York to Northwest Arkansas, Perry Ryan Theater Company presents From Broadway With Love at Crystal Bridges Museum of American Art on Feb 17 and 18.

  • All I ask of you: Broadway star Eryn LeCroy will perform love songs from Phantom of the Opera, Carousel, My Fair Lady, and more, accompanied by Dan Miccicchi, the musical director of Wicked on Broadway.
  • Broadway for all: The theater enthusiasts behind Perry Ryan Theater Company are passionate about making Broadway-quality theater experiences accessible for all generations and incomes by partnering New York professionals with local talent.

Sounds like a crazy-romantic Valentine's date idea! Get your tickets HERE.

posts.title: Eat Your Way Through NWA During National Breakfast Month
posts.content:
February is National Hot Breakfast Month, and we're happy to share our guide to Northwest Arkansas's go-to brunch spots! How many do you think you can try before the end of the month?

  • Classic diners: If you're looking for a classic diner vibe, look no further. We'd recommend Susan's in Springdale, Rick's Iron Skillet in Fayetteville, or Wesner's Grill in Rogers. Another favorite, not listed in the guide, is Neal's Cafe in Springdale. Bright hot pink walls filled with taxidermy. What's better than that?
  • Boujee breakfast: Want something a little fancier? Try Hail Fellow Well Met in Johnson, Mocking Bird Kitchen in Fayetteville, Mirabella's Table in Rogers, or The Hive in Bentonville.

Find other diners, restaurants, food trucks, and bakeries in our guide HERE.

posts.title: Northwest Arkansas Saw A 23% Decrease In SBA Lending In 2022
posts.content:
Northwest Arkansas banks distributed fewer Small Business Administration loans to local businesses during the most recent fiscal year, showing a decrease of 23% compared to the previous period.

  • Totaling it up: The ten lenders with Northwest Arkansas offices issued 49 SBA loans valuing $27.22m last fiscal year, compared to the previous year's 64 loans worth $39.21m.
  • At the front: In terms of both numbers and volume, Arvest Bank was the state's top lender, offering 45 small business loans totaling $8.6m.

Read more from Talk Business & Politics HERE.

posts.title: Cool Jobs in NWA
posts.content:
Looking for a job? Check out these positions posted to our community board:

  • Lifewater International has an open position for a Marketing Project Manager*
  • OneStone is looking for a Client Manager

Have a job you're looking to fill? Post it here!

posts.title: Fayetteville Will Keep It Funky During The Fat Saturday Parade Of Fools
posts.content:
After a two-year hiatus due to the pandemic, the Fayetteville Mardi Gras Parade will return for its 30th Anniversary on Feb 18 at 2p in Downtown Fayetteville.

  • Float on: All are welcome to decorate and enter a float in the family-friendly Fat Saturday Parade of Fools, or register your business as a sponsor! All proceeds this year will support the work of Peace at Home Shelter.
  • Dance and sing: This year's parade will be extra music-filled thanks to a partnership with Music Moves and the Black Music & Film Expo; the UAPB Marching Band will join the parade, followed by a performance by The Racy Brothers and Crescent City Combo at George's Majestic Lounge.

Hear from the parade and music expo organizers on KUAF HERE.

posts.title: Weekend Roundup
posts.content:
After another week of icy weather, we can't wait to get out of the house. Thankfully, the roads are finally thawing out, so let's get out there and enjoy this weekend!

  • Pump up the jams: Check out KUAF's rundown of the local live music taking the stage at venues across Northwest Arkansas this weekend.
  • Art walk: Check out the new Alfred Stieglitz photography exhibit at Crystal Bridges.
  • Date night: Plan an early Valentine's date at one of these romantic dinner spots!
  • New menu: You've got to try the pork belly carnitas at Loma, a new restaurant that opened this week at ONE Uptown in Rogers!
  • At the movies: Pass the popcorn and don't miss the opening weekend of the Fayetteville-filmed movie Freedom's Path on-screen at the AMC Fiesta Square.
  • Behind the mask: The Junior League of Northwest Arkansas's annual fundraiser, the Moonlight Masquerade Gala, is this Friday, Feb 3, at 7p, raising awareness about domestic violence.
  • Ride on: Defrost your mountain bikes and join the Women of OZ for their February Flagship Ride on Saturday, Feb 4, at 2p.
  • Cold reminder: To the lucky ones who got tickets before they sold out, here's your reminder that Frost Fest is this Saturday, Feb 4.

Have a fantastic weekend, everyone! See you next Monday.

posts.title: Making Healthy Eating Exciting Through Garden Based Education
posts.content:
Serving the community from their 2-acre farm at Fayetteville's Gulley Park, Apple Seeds Teaching Farm is on a mission to inspire healthy living through garden-based education.

  • Feed and teach: Beyond providing fresh produce to food-insecure children in NWA, Apple Seeds partners with local schools to provide nutrition education through programs like Cooking in Schools, Food Lab field trips, and more.
  • Play with your food: The Kid's Table is a weeklong summer camp where kids from K-12 grade gain hands-on gardening experience, harvest fresh ingredients for themselves, and learn how to make delicious recipes.

Explore the learning opportunities at Apple Seeds Teaching Farm HERE.

posts.title: Fluid Truck Grows Its Fleet In Northwest Arkansas
posts.content:
Fluid Trucks, an on-demand commercial vehicle rental platform for individuals and small businesses, is investing in Northwest Arkansas, no doubt drawn by the opportunities made available by the region's thriving startup culture.

  • Out for delivery: The Colorado-based company offers 24/7 access to cargo vans, box trucks, and pick-up trucks 365 days a year through its mobile app, making renting commercial vehicles as easy as pushing a button.
  • That cargo fast: Fluid Trucks is one of the fastest-growing tech companies in the nation and launched its Northwest Arkansas operations in Oct 2022, staging its rental vehicles at Pinnacle Hills Promenade in Rogers near Target.

Read more from Talk Business & Politics HERE.

posts.title: AMMPLIFY Festival And Mentorship Program Coming To Mount Sequoyah
posts.content:
Fayetteville's Mount Sequoyah Center will launch AMMPLIFY, which stands for Arts & Music Mentorship Program, on May 6, bringing a multi-disciplinary festival and training opportunity for the region's emerging artists.

  • Creative investment: Led by the center's Creative Spaces NWA program and funded by a grant from the Walmart Foundation, the primary goal of AMMPLIFY is to further establish Fayetteville as a creative-friendly city where artists connect, develop, and flourish.
  • Apprentice: Over the 18-month program, mentors in graphic design, visual arts, AV technology, music management, music performance, and arts management will guide participants through the process of creating a festival-style event on the mountain.

Follow along with AMMPLIFY on Instagram for updates HERE.

posts.title: Artist Risa Puno Will Visit Springdale To Discuss Art Installation
posts.content:
New York City-based artist Risa Puno will return to NWA to discuss her art installation, Come By, currently on display at Downtown Springdale’s Famous Hardware building. The free reception begins at 6pm on Feb 9 at The Medium at 214 S Main Street. 

  • Meet the artists: Puno will be joined by contributing artists Amber Perrodin of Springdale and Reilly Dickens-Hoffman of Fayetteville for a lively discussion over complimentary snacks and beverages, followed by a walk with the artists to view the installation. 
  • In the window: Famous Hardware Installations are a collaboration between the Downtown Springdale Alliance and CACHE with funding support from the Tyson Family Foundation.

Please RSVP for the event HERE.

posts.title: Tyson Foods And J.B. Hunt Make Fortune's 2023 World's Most Admired Companies List
posts.content:
Making Northwest Arkansas proud, Tyson Foods and J.B. Hunt have been listed among Fortune Magazine's World's Most Admired Companies for 2023.

  • Not their first rodeo: Tyson Foods ranked No. 1 in the Food Production category for the seventh year in a row, and J.B. Hunt made the prestigious list for the 12th time in the company's history.
  • Reputation: The annual survey by Fortune and Korn Ferry measures corporate reputation and performance on key attributes like employee retention, innovation, social responsibility, global effectiveness, and more.

KNWA details why these companies are globally admired HERE.

posts.title: Northwest Arkansas Contributes To State's Record Setting Year In Tourism
posts.content:
Last year was a record-setting year for Arkansas's tourism and hospitality sector, according to Talk Business & Politics's latest Jan-Oct 2022 Arkansas Tourism Ticker.

  • Fast pace: Benton and Washington Counties led the state in year-over-year hospitality tax revenue growth. Benton County saw a 56.3% increase over 2021, bringing in $2.6m, and Washington County collected $1.76m, a 37.6% increase.
  • City to city: Behind Little Rock, Fayetteville brought in the second-highest revenue from tourism, collecting $7.83m, a 16.6% increase over its 2021 numbers.

Read more details from Talk Business & Politics HERE.

posts.title: Celebrating Black History Month In Northwest Arkansas
posts.content:
February is Black History Month, a celebration of the achievements and recognition of the Black community's central role in U.S. history, and there are numerous ways to celebrate in Northwest Arkansas.

  • On-screen: Support Black arts, music, and film with Music Moves during the Arkansas Black Music & Film Expo in Fayetteville on Feb 17-18 with film screenings at the Fayetteville Town Center and concerts at George's Majestic Lounge.
  • In business: The fifth Black Owned Business Expo is set for Feb 25 from 10a-4p at the Fayetteville Town Center, showcasing over 60 businesses from the region with wares ranging from vintage apparel to baked goods, candles, and more.

Check out the Black in NWA newsletter for more events HERE.

posts.title: Fayetteville's Historic Ice House Sells Units For $1.47m
posts.content:
Three commercial units in Downtown Fayetteville's historic Ice House building have been purchased for $1.47m.

  • Fresh beets: The new owner, Dylan Maisel of New Orleans, plans to use the space to open a Northwest Arkansas location of his health restaurant and smoothie shop, The Daily Beet.
  • Welcome to the neighborhood: The Ice House, located at 339 N West Ave right off Dickson St, is a mixed-use building and home to Ice House Tattoo, In Motion Boutique, and several residential units.

Read about this development and more from Talk Business & Politics HERE.

posts.title: Elle King Joins The Lineup Of FreshGrass | Bentonville
posts.content:
Multi-platinum artist Elle King has been added to the lineup for FreshGrass | Bentonville, joining the outstanding bluegrass and roots artists coming to Bentonville on May 19-20.

  • Music connects: Alongside bands like Caamp, Mavis Staples, and Sierra Ferrell, the festival will also include FreshSongs, first-time music performances created by international songwriters at The House of Songs exclusively for the festival.
  • Movies and more: Beyond the music, the family-friendly festival will offer activities, local food and drink, local vendors, food and beverages, and a viewing of FreshScores, a silent film featuring original live music.

Read more about the upcoming festival HERE.

posts.title: Crystal Bridges Announces Exhibitions Coming In 2023
posts.content:
From Diego Rivera to Annie Leibovitz, the 2023 Exhibition lineup at Crystal Bridges Museum of American Art will feature some of the most iconic artists of the twentieth and twenty-first centuries.

  • A lasting vision: Deigo Rivera's America brings together over 150 of Rivera's art pieces, examining the social and cultural life of Mexico and America from the 1920s to the 1940s, in the first major exhibition focused exclusively on the Mexican artist in over 20 years.
  • Say cheese: One of the most accomplished photographers of the last fifty years, Annie Leibovitz has highlighted society in publications like The Rolling Stone, Vanity Fair, and Vogue. Annie Leibovitz: Portraits explores American identities, human relationships, current events, and more through her thoughtful photography.

Find these exhibitions and more in the 2023 lineup HERE.

posts.title: Freedom's Path Hits Theaters This February
posts.content:
Produced by Fayettevlle-based Rockhill Studios, the civil-war era story Freedom's Path will debut on Feb 3, showing locally at AMC Fiesta Square in Fayetteville.

  • The plot: According to Screenrant, the story follows the Union soldier William, who intentionally injures himself and deserts battle to avoid death but gets caught up in the crossfires of Confederates hunting a group of Black fighters. 
  • Hey, I've been there: The movie was primarily filmed in the fall of 2019 at multiple Northwest Arkansas locations like Prairie Grove Battlefield Park, War Eagle Mill, Lincoln, Cane Hill, and more.

Watch the movie trailer HERE, and book tickets HERE.

posts.title: Your Guide To The Ultimate Northwest Arkansas Valentine's Date
posts.content:
Valentine's Day is right around the corner, and we're here to help you be prepared! Check out our guide to Date Night Spots Around NWA and set up a reservation for you and your special someone.

  • Comfy: If you're keeping it cool this Valentine's, some of our favorite options that feel upscale yet casual are MJ Pizzeria, Local Lime, and Louise at Thaden Field.
  • Classy: Want to put on the ritz and hit the town in style? Make a reservation at one of these fancy establishments: Atlas, The Preacher's Son, or the Heirloom at 1907.

Find descriptions of these spots and more in our guide HERE.
